article.description: UAB has depended on its depth and pressure defense this season, but the Blazers added strong rebounding to the mix in an 87-62 victory over TCU on Saturday.
article.headline: UAB earns first-round tourney bye
article.story: BIRMINGHAM, Ala. (AP) -- UAB has depended on its depth and pressure defense this season, but the Blazers added strong rebounding to the mix in an 87-62 victory over TCU on Saturday. "We're doing a better job of attacking the glass," UAB coach Mike Anderson said. "Our players are getting more physical. Rebounding is all about mindset, and we were getting a lot of offensive rebounds today." Gabe Kennedy led UAB with 18 points and Demario Eddins added 15. Ronell Taylor finished with 10 points for UAB (19-8, 12-4 Conference USA). The victory gives UAB one of the top four seeds and a first round bye for next weeks Conference USA tournament. "They do a good job of building pressure with their defense," TCU coach Neil Dougherty said. "Typically, we handle the press very well. But today we were flat-footed and we didn't attack it well." Corey Santee led TCU (11-16, 7-9) with 17 points. The game was tied 9-all when Sidney Ball hit a 3-pointer to spark a 10-0 UAB run. The Blazers were in control the rest of the way. Eddins scored three straight baskets late in the first half as UAB blew the game open. UAB led by as many as 22 points in the first half and took a 45-28 halftime lead. The Blazers outrebounded TCU 21-9 and forced 15 turnovers in the first half. Ten of those turnovers were on UAB's steals. Kennedy and Eddins scored two baskets each to help UAB build a 26 point led early in the second half. TCU would get no closer than 19 points. Reserve guard Derrick Broom hit three 3-pointers as UAB opened up a 32-point lead down the stretch. UAB finished with a 38-31 advantage on the boards, with Kennedy and Eddins grabbing eight rebounds each.
